title: Exodus Chapter 34 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 34 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 34 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 34.

questions.question: What did the LORD command Moses to do with two tables of stone in Exodus 34:1?
options: Hew two tables of stone like the first
Make wooden tablets
Write the commandments himself
Bring the first tables back
questions.correctAnswer: Hew two tables of stone like the first
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:1 states God told Moses to hew two tables of stone like the first to write upon them the words in the first tables.

questions.question: When was Moses told to come up to Mount Sinai according to Exodus 34:2?
options: In the morning
At night
At noon
At sunset
questions.correctAnswer: In the morning
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:2 instructs Moses to be ready and come up to Mount Sinai in the morning.

questions.question: Who was allowed to accompany Moses up Mount Sinai as per Exodus 34:3?
options: No man
Aaron only
The elders
All the Israelites
questions.correctAnswer: No man
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:3 clearly states that no man shall come up with Moses or be seen on the mount.

questions.question: What did the LORD do when He descended in the cloud according to Exodus 34:5?
options: Stood with Moses and proclaimed His name
Gave Moses a new staff
Spoke to the elders
Created fire
questions.correctAnswer: Stood with Moses and proclaimed His name
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:5 tells that the LORD stood with Moses and proclaimed the name of the LORD.

questions.question: According to Exodus 34:6, which of the following attributes does the LORD proclaim about Himself?
options: Merciful, gracious, longsuffering, abundant in goodness and truth
Wrathful and unforgiving
Silent and distant
Proud and mighty
questions.correctAnswer: Merciful, gracious, longsuffering, abundant in goodness and truth
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:6 states the LORD describes Himself as merciful, gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in goodness and truth.

questions.question: What did Moses do after hearing the LORD's proclamation in Exodus 34:8?
options: He bowed his head and worshipped
He ran away
He wept loudly
He destroyed the stone tablets
questions.correctAnswer: He bowed his head and worshipped
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:8 says Moses made haste, bowed his head to the earth, and worshipped.

questions.question: In Exodus 34:9, what did Moses ask the LORD to do for the stiffnecked people?
options: Go among them and pardon their iniquity and sin
Destroy them
Send another prophet
Give them more laws
questions.correctAnswer: Go among them and pardon their iniquity and sin
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:9 has Moses praying that the LORD would go among them and pardon their sins because they are stiffnecked.

questions.question: According to Exodus 34:10, what did God promise before all the people?
options: To do marvels never done before on earth
To send a flood
To make the people rich
To let them conquer Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: To do marvels never done before on earth
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:10 says God promised to do marvels such as had not been done in all the earth nor any nation.

questions.question: Which nations did the LORD say He would drive out before Israel in Exodus 34:11?
options: Amorite, Canaanite, Hittite, Perizzite, Hivite, Jebusite
Egyptians, Babylonians, Philistines
Romans, Greeks, Persians
Moabites, Edomites, Amalekites
questions.correctAnswer: Amorite, Canaanite, Hittite, Perizzite, Hivite, Jebusite
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:11 lists these specific nations the LORD will drive out before Israel.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 34:14 says the LORD is a jealous God who will not tolerate worship of other gods.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:14 explicitly states the LORD is a jealous God and forbids worship of other gods.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 34:17 commands the making of molten gods for worship.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:17 clearly commands that no molten gods shall be made.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 34:23 instructs that all men children must appear before the LORD once a year.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:23 states they must appear before the LORD three times a year, not once.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Exodus 34:18: 'The feast of ________ shalt thou keep. Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread...'
options: unleavened bread
tabernacles
firstfruits
passover
questions.correctAnswer: unleavened bread
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:18 commands keeping the feast of unleavened bread for seven days.

questions.question: According to Exodus 34:28, how long was Moses with the LORD on Mount Sinai without eating or drinking?
options: Forty days and forty nights
Seven days
Three days
Ten days
questions.correctAnswer: Forty days and forty nights
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:28 states Moses was with the LORD forty days and forty nights without eating bread or drinking water.

questions.question: What was the visible sign on Moses' face after coming down from Mount Sinai as described in Exodus 34:29?
options: The skin of his face shone
He had a beard of white hair
His eyes were glowing
His hands were scarred
questions.correctAnswer: The skin of his face shone
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:29 says the skin of Moses' face shone as he talked with God.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 34 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 34 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to forgive others who have wronged them. Based on Exodus 34, what biblical truth about God's nature could you share to encourage forgiveness?
options: God is merciful and gracious, forgiving iniquity and transgression
God will always punish the guilty without mercy
God demands strict justice without forgiveness
God only forgives the righteous
questions.correctAnswer: God is merciful and gracious, forgiving iniquity and transgression
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:6-7 describes God as merciful, gracious, and forgiving iniquity and transgression, encouraging believers to emulate His forgiveness.

questions.question: How does Exodus 34 teach us about the importance of obedience in our daily work and rest?
options: Work six days and rest on the seventh day, including during harvest times
Work every day without rest to please God
Rest only on special occasions but work otherwise
Rest is unnecessary if you work hard
questions.correctAnswer: Work six days and rest on the seventh day, including during harvest times
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:21 teaches that six days of work and one day of rest is God's command, showing the value of balance and obedience in work and rest.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to compromise their faith by forming close alliances with ungodly influences. What biblical wisdom from Exodus 34 would you share about this situation?
options: Do not make covenants with the inhabitants of the land to avoid spiritual snares
It is acceptable to join with others regardless of their beliefs
Compromise is necessary for peace
God encourages blending with all peoples
questions.correctAnswer: Do not make covenants with the inhabitants of the land to avoid spiritual snares
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:12-16 warns against making covenants with inhabitants who may lead God's people into idolatry and sin, emphasizing spiritual purity and obedience.

questions.question: How does the command to destroy altars and images in Exodus 34 apply to a believer's spiritual life today?
options: Remove anything that leads you away from worshiping God alone
Keep all traditions regardless of their spiritual impact
Worship multiple gods as a cultural practice
Idols are harmless and can be ignored
questions.correctAnswer: Remove anything that leads you away from worshiping God alone
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:13-14 commands destruction of altars and images to prevent idolatry, teaching believers to eliminate spiritual distractions and false worship.

questions.question: A Christian couple is seeking guidance on how to maintain faithfulness in their marriage. What does Exodus 34 teach about loyalty to God that also applies to marital faithfulness?
options: The LORD is a jealous God who desires exclusive devotion
It is acceptable to divide loyalty between God and others
Jealousy is a sign of weakness
Faithfulness to God is optional
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is a jealous God who desires exclusive devotion
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:14 shows God's jealousy for His people, highlighting the importance of exclusive loyalty, which parallels faithfulness in marriage relationships.

questions.question: How does Exodus 34 guide believers in expressing humility and gratitude before God?
options: Bow your head and worship God with reverence and humility
Approach God with pride and self-sufficiency
Ignore God's presence
Demand God’s blessings without worship
questions.correctAnswer: Bow your head and worship God with reverence and humility
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:8 describes Moses bowing his head and worshipping, modeling humility and gratitude in God's presence.

questions.question: What does Exodus 34 teach about the importance of spiritual discipline and devotion through Moses' time on Mount Sinai?
options: Moses stayed 40 days and nights without food or water to receive God's covenant
Spiritual discipline is unnecessary for faith
Short prayers suffice instead of long devotion
Physical needs are more important than spiritual focus
questions.correctAnswer: Moses stayed 40 days and nights without food or water to receive God's covenant
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:28 shows Moses' dedication in fasting and prayer, emphasizing the value of spiritual discipline in receiving God's Word.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 34, God promises to perform wonders before all the people as part of His covenant.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:10 states God will do marvels before all the people as part of the covenant, showing His power and faithfulness.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 34 instructs believers to offer sacrifices with leaven during the feast of Passover.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:25 instructs that the blood of sacrifices must not be offered with leaven and that the Passover sacrifice must not be left until morning, emphasizing purity and obedience.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Exodus 34 teaches that the feast of unleavened bread is to be kept for ______ days, and during this time, unleavened bread is to be eaten as commanded.
options: Seven
Three
Ten
Fourteen
questions.correctAnswer: Seven
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:18 commands keeping the feast of unleavened bread for seven days, eating unleavened bread as a remembrance of leaving Egypt.

questions.question: How does Exodus 34 emphasize the importance of integrity and honesty in stewardship regarding firstborn animals?
options: The firstborn animals belong to the Lord and must be either sacrificed or redeemed
It is acceptable to keep firstborn animals without offering them to God
Only some animals need to be offered to God
Firstborn animals can be sold for profit without restriction
questions.correctAnswer: The firstborn animals belong to the Lord and must be either sacrificed or redeemed
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:19-20 teaches that firstborn animals are dedicated to God and must be handled according to His commands, reflecting integrity in stewardship.

questions.question: A believer asks how to maintain a consistent fellowship with God despite challenges. What does Exodus 34 suggest about approaching God regularly?
options: Appear before the LORD thrice in the year as a sign of devotion
Only seek God once in a lifetime
God does not require regular fellowship
Fellowship is only necessary on special holidays
questions.correctAnswer: Appear before the LORD thrice in the year as a sign of devotion
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:23 instructs appearing before God three times a year, emphasizing regular fellowship and worship as part of faithful living.

questions.question: What biblical principle about prayer and intercession is modeled by Moses in Exodus 34?
options: Moses interceded for the people, asking God to forgive their sins
Moses demanded God punish the people without mercy
Moses ignored the people's sin
Moses relied on his own strength instead of prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Moses interceded for the people, asking God to forgive their sins
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:9 records Moses praying for God's presence and forgiveness for the stiffnecked people, demonstrating intercessory prayer.

questions.question: How does Exodus 34 demonstrate the value of humility and transparency in leadership through Moses' shining face?
options: Moses' face shone after speaking with God, showing his close relationship and humility
Moses hid his face to appear powerful
Moses refused to share God's words with the people
Moses boasted about his shining face
questions.correctAnswer: Moses' face shone after speaking with God, showing his close relationship and humility
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:29-35 shows Moses' face shining from God's presence and his humility in veiling it when speaking to the people, modeling godly leadership.

questions.question: Based on Exodus 34, what is the significance of not seething a kid in its mother's milk?
options: It is a command to respect God's laws and avoid mixing life and death symbolically
It is an outdated cultural practice with no meaning
It means to never cook any meat
It permits mixing meat and dairy freely
questions.correctAnswer: It is a command to respect God's laws and avoid mixing life and death symbolically
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:26 commands not to seethe a kid in its mother's milk, symbolizing separation and respect for God's commandments.

questions.question: How does Exodus 34 instruct believers to share the message of God's covenant with others?
options: Moses shared all the LORD’s commandments with the people after meeting God
Keep God’s commandments secret
Only priests should know God’s covenant
Share only parts of God’s laws
questions.correctAnswer: Moses shared all the LORD’s commandments with the people after meeting God
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:32 shows Moses giving all the commandments to the children of Israel, emphasizing the importance of faithfully sharing God's Word with the community.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 34 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 34.

questions.question: What is the significance of the LORD proclaiming His name as "merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in goodness and truth" in Exodus 34:6?
options: It emphasizes God's covenantal mercy and justice throughout generations
It shows God's willingness to tolerate sin without consequences
It indicates God's indifference to human behavior
It reflects a later theological development unrelated to Exodus
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes God's covenantal mercy and justice throughout generations
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:6-7 describes God's character highlighting mercy and justice, foundational for His covenant relationship with Israel, showing both forgiveness and righteous judgment.

questions.question: According to Exodus 34:1, why was Moses commanded to hew two new tables of stone?
options: To replace the first tables that were broken
To have an extra set in case of loss
To give to the elders of Israel
To present to Pharaoh as a peace offering
questions.correctAnswer: To replace the first tables that were broken
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:1 explicitly states that Moses was to prepare two new stone tablets like the first, because he broke the first set in anger.

questions.question: In the instructions of Exodus 34:3, why were no people or animals allowed on Mount Sinai with Moses?
options: To maintain the holiness and exclusivity of the encounter with God
To prevent theft of the tablets
To allow animals to graze peacefully nearby
To avoid disturbing the neighboring tribes
questions.correctAnswer: To maintain the holiness and exclusivity of the encounter with God
questions.explanation: Verse 3 makes clear that no one was to accompany Moses nor be seen on the mountain to emphasize the sacredness of God's revelation to Moses alone.

questions.question: What is the theological implication of God describing Himself as a "jealous God" in Exodus 34:14?
options: God demands exclusive worship and rejects idolatry
God is envious of other gods
God tolerates all forms of worship
God is indifferent to Israel's religious practices
questions.correctAnswer: God demands exclusive worship and rejects idolatry
questions.explanation: The term "jealous" in Exodus 34:14 reflects God's demand for Israel's exclusive loyalty and forbids worship of other gods, a key theme in covenant fidelity.

questions.question: Exodus 34:18 commands the observance of which feast, linking it to the time when Israel came out of Egypt?
options: The Feast of Unleavened Bread
The Feast of Tabernacles
The Feast of Pentecost
The Day of Atonement
questions.correctAnswer: The Feast of Unleavened Bread
questions.explanation: Verse 18 commands the Feast of Unleavened Bread to be kept in the month Abib, commemorating Israel's exodus from Egypt.

questions.question: What does the mention of redeeming the firstling of an ass with a lamb in Exodus 34:20 indicate about Israelite sacrificial practices?
options: Certain animals required substitution to preserve holiness
All firstborn animals must be sacrificed without exception
Donkeys were considered unclean and not redeemable
Only lambs were acceptable sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Certain animals required substitution to preserve holiness
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:20 prescribes that the firstborn donkey must be redeemed with a lamb, indicating substitutionary sacrifice practices for non-typical clean animals.

questions.question: How does the instruction in Exodus 34:26, "Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk," reflect ancient Near Eastern cultural context?
options: It forbids a pagan Canaanite ritual involving such cooking
It promotes economical use of food resources
It encourages mixing meat and dairy for flavor
It is a dietary rule unique to Israel without external influence
questions.correctAnswer: It forbids a pagan Canaanite ritual involving such cooking
questions.explanation: This prohibition in Exodus 34:26 is widely understood as rejecting pagan fertility rites common in the ancient Near East, thus setting Israel apart.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 34:28, Moses ate and drank normally while he stayed on Mount Sinai for forty days and nights.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:28 clearly states that Moses neither ate bread nor drank water during the forty days and nights, emphasizing his fasting and dedication.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in the repeated cycle of Moses removing and putting back the veil over his face in Exodus 34:33-35?
options: Chiasm illustrating the tension between divine encounter and human limitation
Allegory for Israel's political struggles
Hyperbole emphasizing Moses' authority
Parable teaching about forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm illustrating the tension between divine encounter and human limitation
questions.explanation: The veil motif creates a chiastic structure symbolizing the interplay between God's glory and Moses' human frailty as he mediates the covenant.

questions.question: Exodus 34:10 contains a covenant promise that God will do "marvels such as have not been done". How does this foreshadow later biblical events?
options: It anticipates the miraculous acts in Israel's conquest of Canaan and salvation history
It predicts the Temple's destruction
It refers only to the giving of the Law
It suggests future exile and punishment
questions.correctAnswer: It anticipates the miraculous acts in Israel's conquest of Canaan and salvation history
questions.explanation: God's promise in verse 10 prefigures the extraordinary acts in conquering the land and later redemptive miracles throughout biblical history.

questions.question: Which nations does God say He will drive out before Israel according to Exodus 34:11, reflecting the historical context of the land?
options: Amorite, Canaanite, Hittite, Perizzite, Hivite, and Jebusite
Philistine, Moabite, Edomite, Ammonite
Egyptians, Babylonians, Assyrians
Romans, Greeks, Persians
questions.correctAnswer: Amorite, Canaanite, Hittite, Perizzite, Hivite, and Jebusite
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:11 lists these specific peoples who inhabited Canaan, reflecting the ancient Near Eastern geopolitical landscape.

questions.question: How does the command in Exodus 34:12 to avoid covenants with the land's inhabitants relate to Israel's identity and purity?
options: It protects Israel from idolatry and cultural assimilation
It promotes political alliances
It encourages trade and intermarriage
It allows compromise in worship practices
questions.correctAnswer: It protects Israel from idolatry and cultural assimilation
questions.explanation: By forbidding covenants with native peoples, verse 12 aims to maintain Israel's religious and cultural distinctiveness.

questions.question: In what way does Moses’ shining face after encountering God in Exodus 34:29-30 prefigure New Testament themes?
options: It foreshadows the transfiguration of Jesus and the presence of divine glory
It symbolizes Moses' political power
It indicates a physical disease
It represents a loss of identity
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows the transfiguration of Jesus and the presence of divine glory
questions.explanation: Moses’ radiant face in verses 29-30 is seen typologically as a precursor to Christ’s transfiguration, revealing divine glory to humanity.

questions.question: What is the significance of the command in Exodus 34:27 for Moses to write the words of the covenant?
options: It establishes the written covenant as authoritative and binding
It is a mere formality without legal weight
It was intended solely for the priests
It was to be hidden from the people
questions.correctAnswer: It establishes the written covenant as authoritative and binding
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:27 underscores the importance of documenting the covenant, affirming its permanence and public authority.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 34:23, all Israelite men were required to appear before the LORD three times a year.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 23 mandates that all male Israelites appear before God thrice annually at appointed feasts, reinforcing communal worship and covenantal accountability.

questions.question: How does the covenant renewal in Exodus 34 relate to the broader theme of God's faithfulness in the Old Testament?
options: It confirms God’s commitment to His promises despite Israel’s failures
It marks a new, unrelated covenant
It indicates God’s regret for making the first covenant
It shows God’s abandonment of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It confirms God’s commitment to His promises despite Israel’s failures
questions.explanation: The renewal in chapter 34 demonstrates God's unchanging faithfulness, reaffirming His covenant even after Israel's breach.

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 34 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 34 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What action did the LORD command Moses to perform before He would write on the new tablets?
options: Hew two tables of stone like the first
Build an altar on Mount Sinai
Gather the elders of Israel
Offer a burnt sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: Hew two tables of stone like the first
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:1 records that the LORD instructed Moses to hew two tables of stone like the first, indicating God's intention to renew the covenant after the breaking of the original tablets. This reflects God's faithfulness to His covenant promises (Jeremiah 31:31-34; 2 Corinthians 3:3-6; Hebrews 8:6-13).

questions.question: Which attribute of God is emphasized when He 'passed by before Moses and proclaimed' His name?
options: Merciful and gracious
Wrathful and judging
Silent and distant
Unchanging and indifferent
questions.correctAnswer: Merciful and gracious
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:6 emphasizes God's mercy, grace, longsuffering, goodness, and truth when He reveals His name to Moses. This revelation highlights the covenantal character of God, consistent with His steadfast love in Psalm 103:8, Joel 2:13, and Jesus' teaching on God's mercy in Luke 6:36.

questions.question: According to Exodus 34, what is the consequence for those who are guilty of sin?
options: God will by no means clear the guilty
They will be immediately forgiven
They will be ignored by God
They will receive a second chance without penalty
questions.correctAnswer: God will by no means clear the guilty
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:7 states that God will by no means clear the guilty, showing His justice alongside His mercy. This balance is reflected in Romans 3:25-26, Hebrews 10:26-31, and Psalm 89:14 where God's righteousness demands judgment of sin.

questions.question: What was Moses' response upon hearing the LORD proclaim His name and attributes?
options: He bowed his head toward the earth and worshipped
He questioned the LORD's justice
He immediately descended the mountain
He wrote down the words without speaking
questions.correctAnswer: He bowed his head toward the earth and worshipped
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:8 describes Moses' humble worship in response to God's self-revelation, an act consistent with reverent fear and awe seen in Isaiah 6:5, Revelation 4:10, and Daniel 9:4.

questions.question: What covenantal promise did God make to Israel in Exodus 34?
options: He will do marvels such as have not been done in any nation
He will give them riches and long life
He will exempt them from all wars
He will allow them to worship other gods
questions.correctAnswer: He will do marvels such as have not been done in any nation
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:10 promises a covenant marked by extraordinary divine acts before all Israel, affirming God's sovereign power and faithfulness (Deuteronomy 7:19, Joshua 24:17, Psalm 78:43, Acts 7:36).

questions.question: Which nations did God command Israel to drive out from the land?
options: Amorite, Canaanite, Hittite, Perizzite, Hivite, and Jebusite
Philistine, Moabite, Ammonite, Edomite, Midianite, and Assyrian
Egyptian, Babylonian, Persian, Greek, Roman, and Syrian
Edomite, Ishmaelite, Amalekite, Canaanite, Hittite, and Philistine
questions.correctAnswer: Amorite, Canaanite, Hittite, Perizzite, Hivite, and Jebusite
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:11 lists these specific nations to be driven out, reflecting God's judgment against idolatry and covenant unfaithfulness (Deuteronomy 7:1-2; Joshua 3:10; Judges 3:5-6; 1 Kings 9:21).

questions.question: Why does God warn Israel against making covenants with the inhabitants of the land?
options: Because it would become a snare leading to idolatry
Because it would bring military defeat
Because it would cause economic hardship
Because it would lead to famine
questions.correctAnswer: Because it would become a snare leading to idolatry
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:12 warns Israel to avoid covenants that could lead them into idolatry and unfaithfulness, a theme repeated in Judges 2:2-3, 1 Kings 11:4, and 2 Corinthians 6:14-16.

questions.question: What specific acts of idolatry does God command Israel to destroy in the land?
options: Altars, images, and groves
Temples, synagogues, and shrines
Books, scrolls, and idols
Altars, statues, and fountains
questions.correctAnswer: Altars, images, and groves
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:13 commands the destruction of altars, images, and groves, symbolizing the comprehensive rejection of pagan worship (Deuteronomy 12:2-3; 1 Kings 18:40; Psalm 115:4-8; Jeremiah 10:1-16).

questions.question: What title of God in Exodus 34 emphasizes His zeal for exclusive worship?
options: Jealous God
Almighty God
Everlasting God
Sovereign King
questions.correctAnswer: Jealous God
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:14 calls God a 'Jealous God,' highlighting His demand for exclusive devotion, a concept echoed in Deuteronomy 6:15, Nahum 1:2, and 2 Corinthians 11:2.

questions.question: What feast does God command Israel to keep to remember their deliverance from Egypt?
options: The Feast of Unleavened Bread
The Feast of Tabernacles
The Feast of Trumpets
The Day of Atonement
questions.correctAnswer: The Feast of Unleavened Bread
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:18 commands the Feast of Unleavened Bread to be observed as a memorial of the Exodus, consistent with Leviticus 23:5-6, Deuteronomy 16:3, and Christ's fulfillment of the Passover in Luke 22:1-20.

questions.question: What must be done with the firstborn male of the cattle, according to Exodus 34?
options: It belongs to the LORD
It must be sold to foreigners
It should be left to roam free
It must be given as a gift to the priests
questions.correctAnswer: It belongs to the LORD
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:19 states that every firstborn male of cattle is the LORD's, reflecting the theme of consecration and God's ownership (Numbers 18:15-17; Deuteronomy 15:19-23; Luke 2:23; Hebrews 12:23).

questions.question: How is the firstborn donkey to be treated if not redeemed with a lamb?
options: Its neck shall be broken
It shall be set free
It shall be sacrificed
It shall be sold
questions.correctAnswer: Its neck shall be broken
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:20 prescribes breaking the neck of the firstborn donkey if it is not redeemed with a lamb, illustrating the seriousness of consecration and substitutionary redemption (Numbers 18:15-16; Exodus 13:13; Luke 19:30-35).

questions.question: How often are men of Israel commanded to appear before the LORD according to Exodus 34?
options: Thrice in the year
Once a year
Every month
Every Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Thrice in the year
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:23 commands the men of Israel to appear before the LORD three times annually, a practice confirmed in Deuteronomy 16:16 and fulfilled typologically in the New Testament (John 7:2-14).

questions.question: What instruction is given regarding the offering of blood sacrifices with leaven?
options: Do not offer the blood of sacrifice with leaven
Offer blood sacrifices only with leaven
Leaven is allowed in all sacrifices
Leaven must be added to all grain offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Do not offer the blood of sacrifice with leaven
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:25 forbids offering the blood of sacrifice with leaven, symbolizing purity and separation from corruption or sin (Leviticus 2:11; 1 Corinthians 5:7-8; Matthew 26:17-19).

questions.question: What is the significance of Moses' face shining after speaking with God?
options: It revealed the glory of God reflected on Moses
It indicated Moses had sinned
It showed Moses was angry
It symbolized Moses' physical strength
questions.correctAnswer: It revealed the glory of God reflected on Moses
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:29-30 describes Moses' face shining due to God's glory, a manifestation of divine presence and holiness seen also in 2 Corinthians 3:7-18 and Numbers 12:6-8, symbolizing transformation by God's revelation.

questions.question: Why did Moses wear a veil after speaking with the people?
options: Because the glory of his face was shining and was too radiant
To hide his identity from the people
To protect himself from the sun
As a sign of mourning
questions.correctAnswer: Because the glory of his face was shining and was too radiant
questions.explanation: Exodus 34:33-35 shows Moses wore a veil to shield the people from the radiance of God's glory on his face, illustrating the holiness of God and the mediated revelation through Moses (2 Corinthians 3:13-16).
